revision.comment: infobox and career stats match played 2 March
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2016}} {{Use British English|date=May 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Connor Mahoney | image = | fullname = Connor Anthony Mahoney{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|2|12|df=y}}{{cite web |url=http://accringtonstanley.co.uk/player/connor-mahoney/ |title=Player profile: Connor Mahoney |publisher=Accrington Stanley F.C |accessdate=17 November 2013}} | birth_place = [[Blackburn]], England{{cite web |url=http://www.11v11.com/players/connor-mahoney-241176/ |title=Connor Mahoney |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=17 November 2013}} | height = {{convert|1.75|m|order=flip}} | position = [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] / [[Forward (association football)#Winger|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]]
(on loan from [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]]) | clubnumber = 7 | youthyears1 = {{0|000}} | youthclubs1 = [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] | youthyears2 = {{0|0000}}–2013 | youthclubs2 = [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] | youthyears3 = 2013–2014 | youthclubs3 = [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] | years1 = 2013 | clubs1 = [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] | caps1 = 4 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2013–2017 | clubs2 = [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] | caps2 = 16 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2017– | clubs3 = [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] | caps3 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018 | clubs4 = → [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] (loan) | caps4 = 4 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = → [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] (loan) | caps5 = 23 | goals5 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2014 | nationalteam1= [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014 | nationalteam2= [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2017 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 17:14, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Connor Anthony Mahoney''' (born 12 February 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a winger for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]], on [[loan (sports)|loan]] from [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] of the [[Premier League]]. ==Career== Initially starting out at Burnley and Blackburn Rovers,{{cite news|title=Sky Sports Scout – Connor Mahoney|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/15198/9163001/sky-sports-scout-connor-mahoney|publisher=Sky Sports|date=21 May 2014|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Mahoney moved to [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]], where he progressed through the academy and began his career there.{{cite news|title=Accrington Stanley's footballing starlets are attracting attention from talent scouts|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/10724952.Accrington_Stanley___s_footballing_starlets_are_attracting_attention_from_talent_scouts/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=8 October 2013|accessdate=31 August 2017}} He then made his professional debut on 28 August 2013 in a 2–0 [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] defeat against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].{{cite news |title=Accrington 0–2 Cardiff|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23776662|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 August 2013|accessdate=4 September 2013}} He then went on to make his league debut coming on as a substitute for [[Shay McCartan]] in the 1–0 home defeat to [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] on 31 August 2013.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23853447|title=Accrington 0–1 Burton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 August 2013|accessdate=13 December 2013}} By the time of his departure from Accrington Stanley, Mahoney went on to make 6 appearances.{{cite news|title=Blackburn Rovers to sign Accrington Stanley star Mahoney|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/10867795.Blackburn_Rovers_to_sign_Accrington_Stanley_star_Mahoney/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=10 December 2013|accessdate=31 August 2017}} ===Blackburn Rovers=== Mahoney signed for [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on 13 December 2013 and linked up with their development squad.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football-25366496|title=Blackburn Rovers sign Connor Mahoney from Accrington Stanley|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 December 2013|accessdate=13 December 2013}} He made an immediate impression and was given squad number 31 for the first team. He was an unused substitute in a 2–1 win against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] at [[Elland Road]] on 1 January 2014. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25512911 "Leeds United 1–2 Blackburn Rovers"] BBC Sport. 1 January 2014. Retrieved 15 January 2014. Mahoney made his competitive debut for Blackburn Rovers on 15 January against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in the [[FA Cup]], replacing [[Lee Williamson]] in the 89th minute of the match.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25647870 "Manchester City 5–0 Blackburn Rovers"] BBC Sport. 15 January 2014. Retrieved 15 January 2014. On 12 February 2014, he signed his first professional contract with the club.{{cite web|title=Birthday boy Connor signs pro|url=http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/birthday-boy-connor-signs-pro-1359643.aspx|publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C.|accessdate=16 February 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140225213140/http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/birthday-boy-connor-signs-pro-1359643.aspx|archivedate=31 August 2017|deadurl=yes}} Following this, Mahoney would spend the next two seasons at the club's reserve, where he developed along the way.{{cite news|title=Who will be the next Blackburn Rovers youngster to break through?|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/12960494.Who_will_be_the_next_Blackburn_Rovers_youngster_to_break_through_/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=20 May 2015|accessdate=31 August 2017}}{{cite news|title=Youngster Connor Mahoney edging back into first-team picture at Blackburn Rovers|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/13785117.Youngster_Connor_Mahoney_edging_back_into_first_team_picture_at_Blackburn_Rovers/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=31 August 2017}} After making no first team appearances in the 2014–15 season, Mahoney said he's making his way to make a breakthrough in the first team for the 2015–16 season.{{cite news|title=Blackburn Rovers youngster Connor Mahoney determined to force his way into first team|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/13800620.Blackburn_Rovers_youngster_Connor_Mahoney_determined_to_force_his_way_into_first_team/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=3 October 2015|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Having played in the reserve side throughout the 2015–16 season,{{cite news|title='He's got a chance' – Paul Lambert reckons Connor Mahoney can become a Blackburn Rovers regular|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/14440621._He_s_got_a_chance____Paul_Lambert_reckons_Connor_Mahoney_can_become_a_Blackburn_Rovers_regular/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=21 April 2016|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Mahoney made his first Blackburn Rovers' appearances in two years, where he started and played 71 minutes before being substituted, in a 1–1 draw against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on 19 April 2016.{{cite news|title=Nottingham Forest 1 – 1 Blackburn Rovers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36021247|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 April 2016|accessdate=31 August 2017}} He also made another appearance, in the follow up match, in a 2–2 draw against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]].{{cite news|title=Blackburn Rovers 2 – 2 Bristol City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36060767|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 April 2016|accessdate=31 August 2017}} At the end of the 2015–16 season, he made 2 appearances for the side. In the 2016–17 season, Mahoney continued to remain in the reserve side at the start of the season, although he appeared twice as an unused substitute in late-August.{{cite news|title=Damien Johnson: Checkatrade Trophy 'perfect stage' for Blackburn Rovers youngsters|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/14711051.Damien_Johnson__Checkatrade_Trophy__perfect_stage__for_Blackburn_Rovers_youngsters/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=30 August 2016|accessdate=31 August 2017}} In late-December, Mahoney began to appear as an unused substitute in a number of games.{{cite news|title=FUTURE STARS: The ones to watch at Blackburn Rovers in 2017...|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/15011655.FUTURE_STARS__The_ones_to_watch_at_Blackburn_Rovers_in_2017___/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=10 January 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Mahoney remained at the club, despite some loan bids from League One clubs for him.{{cite news|title=Owen Coyle keen to keep Connor Mahoney in first team picture as Blackburn Rovers turn down loan bids|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/15023729.Owen_Coyle_keen_to_keep_Connor_Mahoney_in_first_team_picture_as_Blackburn_Rovers_turn_down_loan_bids/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=14 January 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} He then made his first appearance of the 2016–17 season, coming on as a second-half substitute, in a 1–0 win over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on 4 February 2017.{{cite news|title=Blackburn Rovers 1 – 0 Queens Park Rangers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38778703|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 February 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Following this, Mahoney received a handful of first team appearances as Blackburn Rovers fought to survive relegation from the Championship.{{cite news|title=Owen Coyle keen to secure Connor Mahoney's long-term future at Blackburn Rovers but says talks in the hands of Paul Senior|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/15085890.Owen_Coyle_keen_to_secure_Connor_Mahoney_s_long_term_future_at_Blackburn_Rovers_but_says_talks_in_the_hands_of_Paul_Senior/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=11 February 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Then, he set up an equalising goal for [[Derrick Williams (footballer)|Derrick Williams]], in a 1–1 draw against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on 7 March 2017.{{cite news|title=Blackburn Rovers 1 – 1 Cardiff City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39111417|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 March 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} In the following match against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] four days later, he set up a goal for [[Lucas João]] in a 2–2 draw.{{cite news|title=Norwich City 2 – 2 Blackburn Rovers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39162733|publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 March 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} On 14 April 2017, in a match against Nottingham Forest, Mahoney also set up a goal for [[Tommie Hoban]], who scored the only goal in the game.{{cite news|title=Nottingham Forest 0 – 1 Blackburn Rovers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39523090|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 April 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} By the end of the 2016–17 season, which saw Blackburn Rovers relegated to League One, he had made 21 appearances in all competitions. ===AFC Bournemouth=== Following Blackburn Rovers' relegation in summer 2017, Mahoney was offered a new contract by the club.{{cite news|title=Rovers release six first-team players but are looking to secure the future of Connor Mahoney|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/15295134.Rovers_release_six_first_team_players_but_are_looking_to_secure_the_future_of_Connor_Mahoney/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=19 May 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} However, he was also linked with moves away from the club, increasingly attracting interests from Nottingham Forest{{cite news|title=Connor Mahoney: Blackburn's Tony Mowbray expects Nottingham Forest move for winger|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40290745|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 June 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} and [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]].{{cite news|title=Rovers raid? Celtic interested in out-of-contract Blackburn Rovers winger Connor Mahoney, according to reports in England|url=https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/sport/football/1130961/celtic-interest-blackburn-rovers-connor-mahoney-reports/|newspaper=The Scottish Sun|date=15 June 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} It was reported that Mahoney turned down a contract extension at Blackburn Rovers and was set to leave the club.{{cite news|title=Connor Mahoney edging closer to Rovers exit|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/15331547.Connor_Mahoney_edging_closer_to_Rovers_exit/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=7 June 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} On 4 July 2017 Mahoney made a move to [[Premier League]] club [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]], signing a four-year contract.{{cite news|title=Bournemouth sign Connor Mahoney on four-year deal after leaving Blackburn Rovers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40495709|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 July 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} After playing in two cup games for the Cherries in 2017, Connor moved to [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on loan for the second half of the 2017–18 season.{{cite web|title=Mahoney completes Barnsley loan move|url=https://www.afcb.co.uk/news/first-team/mahoney-completes-barnsley-loan-move|date=29 January 2018|accessdate=29 January 2018}} On 7 August 2018, Mahoney joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] on a season-long loan deal.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45098389 |title=Connor Mahoney: Birmingham City sign Bournemouth winger on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 August 2018 |accessdate=8 August 2018}} He made his debut as a second-half substitute in a 1–0 defeat away to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45066579 |title=Middlesbrough 1–0 Birmingham City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}} Having started the match at home to [[Sheffield Wednesday]] on 27 October in place of the injured [[Jacques Maghoma]], Mahoney scored his first career goal just before half-time when he "cut in unchallenged from the left to fire in a right-footed shot past Cameron Dawson into the far roof of the net"; Birmingham went on to win 3–1.{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/birmham-vs-sheff-wed/392711 |title=Birmingham 3-1 Sheffield Wednesday: Blues keep up fine run |publisher=Sky Sports |date=27 October 2018 |accessdate=28 October 2018}} ==International career== In January 2014, he was called up by [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] for the first time.{{cite web|title=Connor gets England call|url=http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/england-call-for-connor-1306783.aspx|publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C.|accessdate=21 January 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140122052323/http://www.rovers.co.uk/news/article/england-call-for-connor-1306783.aspx|archivedate=31 August 2017|deadurl=yes}} Mahoney made his England U17 (and his only appearance for the side) debut, in a 2–1 loss against [[Belgium national under-17 football team|Belgium U17]] on 30 January 2014.{{cite news|title=ENGLAND U17S SUFFER CRUEL DEFEAT AGAINST BELGIUM|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/jan/30/england-u17s-v-belgium-match-report-300114|publisher=The Football Association|date=30 January 2014|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Eight months later, in September 2014, Mahoney was called up by [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]].{{cite web|url=https://www.rovers.co.uk/news/2014/september/england-call-for-connor/|title=England call for Connor|publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C.|date=20 September 2014|accessdate=31 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170831193534/https://www.rovers.co.uk/news/2014/september/england-call-for-connor/|archivedate=31 August 2017|deadurl=no}} Four days later, he made his England U18 debut, in a 2–0 loss against [[Italy national under-18 football team|Italy U18]].{{cite web|url=https://www.rovers.co.uk/news/2014/september/mahoney-plays-for-england/|title=Mahoney plays for England|publisher=Blackburn Rovers F.C.|date=25 September 2014|accessdate=31 August 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170831193522/https://www.rovers.co.uk/news/2014/september/mahoney-plays-for-england/|archivedate=31 August 2017|deadurl=no}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 2 March 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League Championship|Championship]]||0||0||1||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||1||0 |- |[[2014–15 Blackburn Rovers F.C. season|2014–15]]{{Soccerbase season|72094|2014|accessdate=13 October 2017}} |Championship||0||0||0||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||0||0 |- |[[2015–16 Blackburn Rovers F.C. season|2015–16]]{{Soccerbase season|72094|2015|accessdate=13 October 2017}} |Championship||2||0||0||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||2||0 |- |[[2016–17 Blackburn Rovers F.C. season|2016–17]]{{Soccerbase season|72094|2016|accessdate=13 October 2017}} |Championship||14||0||2||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||18||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !16||0||3||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||21||0 |- |[[Blackburn Rovers F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Blackburn Rovers U23]] |2016–17 |colspan=3|—||colspan=2|—||colspan=2|—||3{{efn|name=EFT|Appearances in [[EFL Trophy]]}}||0||3||0 |- |[[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] |[[2017–18 A.F.C. Bournemouth season|2017–18]]{{Soccerbase season|72094|2017|accessdate=28 January 2018}} |[[Premier League]]||0||0||0||0||2||0||colspan=2|—||2||0 |- |[[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Barnsley F.C. season|2017–18]] |Championship||8||0||0||0||0||0||colspan=2|—||8||0 |- |[[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Birmingham City F.C. season|2018–19]]{{Soccerbase season|72094|2018|accessdate=2 March 2019}} |Championship||23||2||1||0||1||0||colspan=2|—||25||2 |- !colspan=3|Career total !51||2||4||0||6||0||4||0||66||2 |} {{notelist}} ==Personal life== Born in [[Blackburn]], England, Mahoney attended [[Witton Park High School]].{{cite news|title=Blackburn's Witton Park honours its students for best ever GCSEs|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/news/10830517.Blackburn_s_Witton_Park_honours_its_students_for_best_ever_GCSEs/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=28 November 2013|accessdate=31 August 2017}} Mahoney grew up supporting Blackburn Rovers.{{cite news|title=Accrington Stanley boss couldn't block Mahoney's Blackburn Rovers move|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/10875865.Accrington_Stanley_boss_couldn_t_block_Mahoney_s_Blackburn_Rovers_move/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=13 December 2013|accessdate=31 August 2017}} His brother Dom is also a footballer.{{cite news|title=Family ties at Nelson|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/11251970.Family_ties_at_Nelson/|newspaper=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=3 June 2014|accessdate=31 August 2017}} ==References== {{reflist}}
